summary: This bill, the Pershing County Economic Development and Conservation Act, focuses on land management and conservation in Pershing County, Nevada. It addresses the sale and exchange of federal land (checkerboard land) for economic development, designates new wilderness areas, and transfers land to the Lovelock Paiute Tribe to be held in trust. The bill also includes provisions for wildlife management, water rights, and the disposition of proceeds from land sales. Furthermore, it details how the Secretary of the Interior will manage and oversee these actions.
